body_html:
The scopes we add by default are fairly stable, right? I'd be happy with either solution, but certainly --accept ing the new output seems easiest.

Last thing: yes, scopes are stable as long as the name of what gets registered in Modules is stable. If the name of a Module variable changes, then the respective expect will be invalid.

I don't have an issue adding a flag to disable the output of scopes, just let me know.

Last thing: yes, scopes are stable as long as the name of what gets registered in Modules is stable. If the name of a Module variable changes, then the respective expect will be invalid.
I don't have an issue adding a flag to disable the output of scopes, just let me know.
body:
> The scopes we add by default are fairly stable, right? I'd be happy with either solution, but certainly --accept ing the new output seems easiest.

Last thing: yes, scopes are stable as long as the name of what gets registered in Modules is stable. If the name of a Module variable changes, then the respective expect will be invalid.

I don't have an issue adding a flag to disable the output of scopes, just let me know.
